headline: Pfizer (PFE) Profit Margins Double—Challenges Bearish View Despite $4.7B Loss and Revenue Headwinds
summary: Pfizer (PFE) posted notable earnings growth, with net profit margins improving to 15.6%, a lift from the previous period’s 7%. Year-over-year, EPS growth soared 133.3%, marking a sharp reversal from the company’s five-year average decline of 13.2% per year, even as a significant one-off loss of $4.7 billion weighed on the latest results. Looking ahead, investors are weighing the company’s stronger margins and attractive valuation multiples against forecasts for a 3.2% annual decline in...

content.title: Pfizer (PFE) Profit Margins Double—Challenges Bearish View Despite $4.7B Loss and Revenue Headwinds
content.summary: Pfizer (PFE) posted notable earnings growth, with net profit margins improving to 15.6%, a lift from the previous period’s 7%. Year-over-year, EPS growth soared 133.3%, marking a sharp reversal from the company’s five-year average decline of 13.2% per year, even as a significant one-off loss of $4.7 billion weighed on the latest results. Looking ahead, investors are weighing the company’s stronger margins and attractive valuation multiples against forecasts for a 3.2% annual decline in...

headline: PFE Q3 Deep Dive: Pipeline, Cost Controls, and Business Development Shape Outlook
summary: Global pharmaceutical company Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) met Wall Streets revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, but sales fell by 5.9% year on year to $16.65 billion. On the other hand, the company’s full-year revenue guidance of $62.5 billion at the midpoint came in 0.5% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.87 per share was 37% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: PFE Q3 Deep Dive: Pipeline, Cost Controls, and Business Development Shape Outlook
content.summary: Global pharmaceutical company Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) met Wall Streets revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, but sales fell by 5.9% year on year to $16.65 billion. On the other hand, the company’s full-year revenue guidance of $62.5 billion at the midpoint came in 0.5% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.87 per share was 37% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Google Clears DOJ Antitrust Hurdle for $32 Billion Wiz Deal
summary: After the companies first announced their tie-up in March, the Justice Department opened up an in-depth probe of the deal, Bloomberg reported in June.  Wiz Chief Executive Officer Assaf Rappaport confirmed at a Wall Street Journal event on Tuesday that the DOJ concluded its review, but the deal is still under scrutiny by other antitrust regulators.  A Google spokesperson didn’t immediately respond outside regular business hours to a request for comment.

content.title: Google Clears DOJ Antitrust Hurdle for $32 Billion Wiz Deal
content.summary: After the companies first announced their tie-up in March, the Justice Department opened up an in-depth probe of the deal, Bloomberg reported in June.  Wiz Chief Executive Officer Assaf Rappaport confirmed at a Wall Street Journal event on Tuesday that the DOJ concluded its review, but the deal is still under scrutiny by other antitrust regulators.  A Google spokesperson didn’t immediately respond outside regular business hours to a request for comment.

headline: Pfizer Responds to Delaware Chancery Court Ruling
summary: NEW YORK, November 05, 2025--Pfizer Inc. (NYSE: PFE) today issued the following statement in response to the Delaware Chancery Court’s decision denying Pfizer’s request for a temporary restraining order to prevent Metsera, Inc. from terminating the existing merger agreement in favor of a competing proposal from Novo Nordisk.

content.title: Pfizer Responds to Delaware Chancery Court Ruling
content.summary: NEW YORK, November 05, 2025--Pfizer Inc. (NYSE: PFE) today issued the following statement in response to the Delaware Chancery Court’s decision denying Pfizer’s request for a temporary restraining order to prevent Metsera, Inc. from terminating the existing merger agreement in favor of a competing proposal from Novo Nordisk.

headline: Moderna Is Running Low on Cash. Its Earnings Are Thursday.
summary: Moderna  reports earnings early Thursday as investors wonder whether the biotech will run through its pandemic-era windfall before it stops losing money.  The vaccine company had accumulated nearly $20 billion in cash by early 2022, thanks to the record-smashing sales of its Covid-19 shot, but has been losing billions of dollars a year since 2023.  Management has said Moderna will have $6 billion left at the end of this year, will stop losing money in 2028, and won’t need to raise any new cash to bridge the gap.

content.title: Moderna Is Running Low on Cash. Its Earnings Are Thursday.
content.summary: Moderna  reports earnings early Thursday as investors wonder whether the biotech will run through its pandemic-era windfall before it stops losing money.  The vaccine company had accumulated nearly $20 billion in cash by early 2022, thanks to the record-smashing sales of its Covid-19 shot, but has been losing billions of dollars a year since 2023.  Management has said Moderna will have $6 billion left at the end of this year, will stop losing money in 2028, and won’t need to raise any new cash to bridge the gap.
